column4: WHYYYYYYY is it so hard to find a program that autodetects hardware and writes an xorg.conf file? that's what happens every time someone starts a livecd, why is it so hard to find the script that does it?
that script works until you installed proprietary graphic drivers
i don't care about proprietary drivers.

A configuration page will appear, asking if you want to autodetect video hardware. Select yes, and you should be able to just hit enter a bunch of times to accept the autodetected configurations. It doesn't ask me to autodetect.
